page.title: 04TYDD ST. GILES -SHIRE DRAIN
page.content: The Shire Drain was always the most important waterway in the parish.It forms a county boundary,a parish boundary,and long ago was a boundary between two Saxon kingdoms,called Mercia and East Anglia.The Shire Drain runs from near Peterborough to Tydd and so on to the sea.It was at sometime the old course of the River Nene,but that river now runs through Wisbech.Parts of the Shire Drain have different names,like Cat Water,The Elloe River and The Shoffendike. Cats Lane is a lane in the village, and is so named because it leads to Cat Water. Mr.Pentelow once found a Roman brooch near the Shire Drain.In a field near the Shire Drain there are some Romano- British kiln bars and some medieval pottery.
